sub_topic: Show that every group of order 10 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C10, the dihedral group D5, or the non-abelian group of order 10.
message_1: Find all possible ways in which a group of order 10 can be generated and determine whether each of these groups is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C10, the dihedral group D5, or the non-abelian group of order 10.
message_2:
To find all possible ways in which a group of order 10 can be generated, we need to consider the possible factorizations of the order of the group. Since 10 = 2 * 5, there are two possible factorizations: 10 = 1 * 10 and 10 = 2 * 5.

1. If the group has a single element of order 10, then it is a cyclic group generated by that element. In this case, the group is isomorphic to the cyclic group C10.

2. If the group has elements of order 2 and 5, then we can consider the following presentation of the group: G = <a, b | a^2 = b^5 = 1, ab = ba^(-1)>. This is the presentation of the dihedral group D5, which has order 10. The group is generated by the elements a and b, where a has order 2 and b has order 5. The relation ab = ba^(-1) ensures that the group is non-abelian.

There are no other possible factorizations of the order of the group, so these are the only two possible ways in which a group of order 10 can be generated.

Now, we will determine whether each of these groups is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C10, the dihedral group D5, or the non-abelian group of order 10.

1. The cyclic group C10 is isomorphic to itself, as it is generated by a single element of order 10.

2. The dihedral group D5 is isomorphic to itself, as it is generated by elements of order 2 and 5, and has the presentation G = <a, b | a^2 = b^5 = 1, ab = ba^(-1)>.

There is no other non-abelian group of order 10, as any group of order 10 must have elements of order 2 and 5, and the only such non-abelian group is the dihedral group D5.

In conclusion, there are two possible ways in which a group of order 10 can be generated: either as a cyclic group C10 or as the dihedral group D5. There is no other non-abelian group of order 10.
